initial_story:
Police have deployed an armoured vehicle to pry open the cabin of a lorry on a motorway in Texas.

The driver refused to stop, or get out of the cab when officers used spike strips to stop the vehicle, police said.

After the armoured vehicle tore open a window, police threw in a gas canister, before going inside and pulling the driver out.

It is unclear what started the chase, but police said the driver used "evasive manoeuvres", changing lanes multiple times and swerving.

“We still don’t know why he was acting in the erratic manner that he was,” Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez told journalists, adding that he appeared to have "some heavy impairment".

A police officer in Texas has been injured after being hit by a vehicle while trying to stop a suspected drunk driver.

The incident occurred around 2 a.m. on Sunday in the city of Houston.

According to police, the officer was attempting to stop a vehicle that was driving erratically.

As the officer approached the vehicle, the driver suddenly accelerated and struck the officer.

The officer was transported to a nearby hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.

The driver of the vehicle fled the scene but was later apprehended.

Police have not released the name of the officer or the driver.

The investigation is ongoing.

Officer Jane Doe was on patrol when she spotted a car weaving in and out of traffic. She immediately pulled the car over and approached the driver, John Smith. As she approached the car, she noticed that Smith had been drinking and was clearly intoxicated.

Officer Doe asked Smith to step out of the car and perform a sobriety test. Smith refused and became aggressive, pushing the officer and trying to flee the scene. Officer Doe used her taser to subdue Smith, but he continued to resist and managed to flee on foot.

Officer Doe pursued Smith on foot, but he was able to get away. However, he was later apprehended by another officer who had been called to the scene. Smith was arrested and charged with driving under the influence, assaulting a police officer, and fleeing the scene of an accident.

The story of Officer Jane Doe has been met with an outpouring of support from the community, with many expressing their gratitude for the officer's service and their hope for a quick recovery. The incident has also sparked a conversation about the dangers of driving under the influence and the importance of responsible drinking.

The incident has also raised questions about the safety of officers on the streets and the need for increased safety measures to protect them. Many people are calling for stricter laws and enforcement to prevent drunk driving and to ensure that drivers are held accountable for their actions.

However, the incident has also led to a debate on the issue of police brutality and whether or not the officer was justified in using excessive force. The incident has also raised questions about the need for better training and accountability for police officers in order to prevent similar incidents in the future.

Officer Jane Doe was on patrol when she spotted a car weaving in and out of traffic. She immediately pulled the car over and approached the driver, John Smith. As she approached the car, she noticed that Smith had been drinking and was clearly intoxicated.

Officer Doe asked Smith to step out of the car and perform a sobriety test. Smith refused and became aggressive, pushing the officer and trying to flee the scene. Officer Doe used her taser to subdue Smith, but he continued to resist and managed to flee on foot.

Officer Doe pursued Smith on foot, but he was able to get away. However, he was later apprehended by another officer who had been called to the scene. Smith was arrested and charged with driving under the influence, assaulting a police officer, and fleeing the scene of an accident.

The story of Officer Jane Doe has been met with an outpouring of support from the community, with many expressing their gratitude for the officer's service and their hope for a quick recovery.
